title: "Hypnotic Communication and Unconscious Learning"
first_phrase: In the previous text, we explored the concept of hypnotic communication and how it can put the interlocutor in a state of active learning at an unconscious level. This learning occurs without the hindrance of conscious thought, and ultimately, behavior changes as a result. In this final section, we delve into the concept of "Truisms" and "Ricalchi" (Linguistic Mirroring) as a technique to create rapport with others. Erickson and Rossi introduced this technique which involves stating objective facts perceived by the interlocutor. We'll see how this can be a powerful tool in creating a connection with others.

last_phrase: In conclusion, utilizing truisms and linguistic recollection can be a simple and effective way to establish a connection with someone and suggest subtle changes in behavior. By observing and commenting on everyday behavior, we can use these techniques to encourage a sense of calm and control, leading to a more positive outcome.
